resources.virtual/status.sh:
#
# Copyright (c) 2016, 2017 by Delphix. All rights reserved.
#

#
# Checks whether the provided location is mounted on the target host.
# Mount checking mechanism is adopted from Delphix Oracle provision scripts (unmount_vdb*.sh)
#
# Since output of `mount` will always be canonical, we must also canonicalize the user provided data directory path
# to ensure proper matching.
#

canonicalize_path() {
    local input_path="${1}"
    local output_path=""

    local pathArr=($(echo ${input_path} | tr "/" " "))
    local pathStack=()

    for item in ${pathArr[@]}; do
        # Ignore "" or "." as the path would remain in same level
        if [[ ${item} != "" && ${item} != "." ]]; then
            if [[ ${item} != ".." ]]; then
                # Push valid path content into "stack"
                pathStack[${#pathStack[*]}]=${item}
            elif [[ ${#pathStack[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
                # Pop off top of "stack" for ".." case
                unset pathStack[${#pathStack[@]}-1]
            fi
        fi
    done

    for pathContent in ${pathStack[@]}; do
        output_path="${output_path}/${pathContent}"
    done

    # If the path deducts to empty, return "/"
    [[ ${output_path} = "" ]] && output_path="/"

    echo ${output_path}
}

check_mounted() {
    if $(type mount >/dev/null 2>&1); then
        mount_output=$(mount)
    elif $(type /usr/sbin/mount >/dev/null 2>&1); then
        mount_output=$(/usr/sbin/mount)
    else
        # Assume running if mount lookup is not possible
        return 0
    fi

    # Handle mount output differences between OS
    if [[ "$DLPX_OS_TYPE" == "SOLARIS" || "$DLPX_OS_TYPE" == "HP_UX" ]]; then
        mount_output=$(echo "${mount_output}" | \
            awk '{if ($1 == mount_point) print $0}' mount_point=$1)
    else
        # LINUX and AIX
        mount_output=$(echo "${mount_output}" | \
            awk '{if ($3 == mount_point) print $0}' mount_point=$1)
    fi
    test -n "$mount_output"
}

check_running() {
    # We track starting/stopping by creating/deleting a sentinel file.
    # If the token file is there, then we are "running"
    STATUS_DIR=${TOOLKIT_DIR}/Delphix-USF
    STATUS_FILE=${STATUS_DIR}/status-${VDB_GUID}
    [ -f ${STATUS_FILE} ]
}

normalized_path=$(canonicalize_path "$DLPX_DATA_DIRECTORY")

if check_mounted ${normalized_path} && check_running; then
    printf "\"ACTIVE\"" > $DLPX_OUTPUT_FILE
    exit 0
else
    printf "\"INACTIVE\"" > $DLPX_OUTPUT_FILE
    exit 0
fi
resources.virtual/start.sh:
#
# Copyright (c) 2017 by Delphix. All rights reserved.
#

# We keep track of whether a VDB is running or not using a sentinel files.
# Each running VDB has its own sentinel file, named using the VDB's GUID.
# All of the sentinel files for a particular host are kept in a single directory,
# inside the Delphix Engine's "toolkit directory".

STATUS_DIR=${TOOLKIT_DIR}/Delphix-USF
STATUS_FILE=${STATUS_DIR}/status-${VDB_GUID}

# Make the sentinel directory, if necessary.
mkdir -p ${STATUS_DIR}

# "starting" just means making sure the sentinel file exists.
touch ${STATUS_FILE}
resources.virtual/status.ps1:
#
# Copyright (c) 2016 by Delphix. All rights reserved.
#

#
# Checks whether the provided location is mounted on the target host.
#

# Normalize mount path as Windows accepts Unix style paths and converts them to Windows style path when mounting
$mountpath = (Resolve-Path -LiteralPath "$env:DLPX_DATA_DIRECTORY").Path

# If the mountpath failed to resolve, it means nothing is mounted at this location
if ($mountpath -ne $null) {
    $mount_point = Get-WmiObject -Class Win32_MountPoint |
    where {$_.Directory -like "Win32_Directory.Name=`"$($mountpath -replace '\\','\\')`""}
    if ($mount_point -ne $null) {
        '"ACTIVE"' | Out-File -Encoding ascii $env:DLPX_OUTPUT_FILE
        exit 0
    }
}

'"INACTIVE"' | Out-File -Encoding ascii $env:DLPX_OUTPUT_FILE
exit 0
resources.virtual/stop.sh:
#
# Copyright (c) 2017 by Delphix. All rights reserved.
#

# We keep track of whether a VDB is running or not using a sentinel files.
# Each running VDB has its own sentinel file, named using the VDB's GUID.
# All of the sentinel files for a particular host are kept in a single directory,
# inside the Delphix Engine's "toolkit directory".

STATUS_DIR=${TOOLKIT_DIR}/Delphix-USF
STATUS_FILE=${STATUS_DIR}/status-${VDB_GUID}

# "Stopping" a VDB just means ensuring that no sentinel file exists.
rm -f ${STATUS_FILE}

linkedSourceDefinition.preSnapshot:
--
-- Copyright (c) 2015 by Delphix. All rights reserved.
--

RunSync {
   environment        = source.environment,
   user               = source.environmentUser,
   host               = source.host,
   sourceDirectory    = source.dataDirectory,
   excludePaths       = parameters.excludes,
   followSymlinkPaths = parameters.followSymlinks
}

virtualSourceDefinition.initialize:
--
-- Copyright (c) 2015, 2017 by Delphix. All rights reserved.
--

if source.osType ~= "WINDOWS" then
    envVar = {
        TOOLKIT_DIR = source.toolkitPath,
        VDB_GUID    = source.guid
    }

    RunBash {
        command     = resources["virtual/start.sh"],
        environment = source.environment,
        user        = source.environmentUser,
        variables   = envVar,
        loginShell = true
    }
end
virtualSourceDefinition.start:
--
-- Copyright (c) 2017 by Delphix. All rights reserved.
--

if source.osType ~= "WINDOWS" then
    envVar = {
        TOOLKIT_DIR = source.toolkitPath,
        VDB_GUID    = source.guid
    }

    RunBash {
        command     = resources["virtual/start.sh"],
        environment = source.environment,
        user        = source.environmentUser,
        variables   = envVar,
        loginShell = true
    }
end
virtualSourceDefinition.unconfigure:
--
-- Copyright (c) 2017 by Delphix. All rights reserved.
--

if source.osType ~= "WINDOWS" then
    envVar = {
        TOOLKIT_DIR = source.toolkitPath,
        VDB_GUID    = source.guid
    }

    RunBash {
        command     = resources["virtual/stop.sh"],
        environment = source.environment,
        user        = source.environmentUser,
        variables   = envVar,
        loginShell = true
    }
end
virtualSourceDefinition.status:
--
-- Copyright (c) 2016, 2017 by Delphix. All rights reserved.
--

envVar = {
    DLPX_DATA_DIRECTORY = source.dataDirectory,
    DLPX_OS_TYPE        = source.osType,
    TOOLKIT_DIR         = source.toolkitPath,
    VDB_GUID            = source.guid
}

if source.osType == "WINDOWS" then
    return RunPowerShell {
        command     = resources["virtual/status.ps1"],
        environment = source.environment,
        user        = source.environmentUser,
        variables   = envVar,
        outputSchema= { type = "string" }
    }
else
    return RunBash {
        command     = resources["virtual/status.sh"],
        environment = source.environment,
        user        = source.environmentUser,
        variables   = envVar,
        outputSchema= { type = "string" },
        loginShell = true
    }
end
virtualSourceDefinition.configure:
--
-- Copyright (c) 2017 by Delphix. All rights reserved.
--

if source.osType ~= "WINDOWS" then
    envVar = {
        TOOLKIT_DIR = source.toolkitPath,
        VDB_GUID    = source.guid
    }

    RunBash {
        command     = resources["virtual/start.sh"],
        environment = source.environment,
        user        = source.environmentUser,
        variables   = envVar,
        loginShell = true
    }
end

return {}
virtualSourceDefinition.stop:
--
-- Copyright (c) 2017 by Delphix. All rights reserved.
--

if source.osType ~= "WINDOWS" then
    envVar = {
        TOOLKIT_DIR = source.toolkitPath,
        VDB_GUID    = source.guid
    }

    RunBash {
        command     = resources["virtual/stop.sh"],
        environment = source.environment,
        user        = source.environmentUser,
        variables   = envVar,
        loginShell = true
    }
end
virtualSourceDefinition.reconfigure:
--
-- Copyright (c) 2017 by Delphix. All rights reserved.
--

if source.osType ~= "WINDOWS" then
    envVar = {
        TOOLKIT_DIR = source.toolkitPath,
        VDB_GUID    = source.guid
    }

    RunBash {
        command     = resources["virtual/start.sh"],
        environment = source.environment,
        user        = source.environmentUser,
        variables   = envVar,
        loginShell = true
    }
end

return {}
